reviewText: My kids loved this and it brought back childhood memories of watching Reading Rainbow.  I let my friend borrow the DVD for her kids and they loved it too!!!

I teach elementary art and the kids learn about Egypt in second grade. This video shows in illustrated form how mummies were made. This was suitable for a second grade audience. It then traveled to a museum and a showed real mummies and how they are preserved. My students favorite part is the middle where a forensic artist reproduces a face from a model skull.
This is a gift for my sister/niece. Reading Rainbow is an absolutely excellent educational children's show that is also fun. It's from the 80s originally, and it absolutely outstanding.

I grew up watching Reading Rainbow and now that it is included on Amazon Prime Video my 3 youngest watch it too!! We bought this one to take on vacation with us and my kids (ages 1,3, and 5) loved it! They especially loved the one about mummies as they love anything that they feel is even remotely related to Halloween. I also enjoyed these 2 episodes immensely and learned a lot myself! I also purchased the books portrayed in the episodes (also from Amazon) and we love the books also
My students and I love Reading Rainbow
Loved this! Used for my students on Ancient Egypt.
I use this as an introduction to not only the mummy making process, but what we can learn from mummies, and what we are doing to protect mummies today.
I wish they would release all RR episodes on dvd. We are very picky about what our kids watch and these are so great! The kids love them and I feel good about what they're watching.
